title: Scoreboard should show previous day's games until 10AM ET
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the device time has not yet passed 10AM
custom_steps: When the user taps the Scoreboard button
custom_expected: Then the user should see the scoreboard for the previous date's games.

title: Scoreboard should flip to the current day at 10am ET
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed 
and the device time is past 10AM ET
custom_steps: When the user taps the Scoreboard button
custom_expected: Then the user should see the scores for that date's games.

title: By default Scoreboard should show all times in EST if set to a non-continental US time zone
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
Given the user's device's time zone is set to a non-continental US time zone (eg. Tokyo, London, etc.)
custom_steps: When the user taps the Scoreboard button
custom_expected: Then the Scoreboard is opened and the user sees scheduled games with times listed in EST

title: By default Scoreboard should show all times in EST unless another continental US time zone is selected (Central, Mountain, Pacific, Alaska, Hawaii-Aleutian)
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
Given the user's device's time zone is set to a continental US time zone (eg. Central, Mountain, Pacific, Alaska, Hawaii-Aleutian.)
custom_steps: When the user taps the Scoreboard button
custom_expected: Then the Scoreboard is opened and the user sees scheduled games with the corresponding US time zone selected

title: Should be sorted by game state (finished games at the bottom) and chronologically (earlier at the top, later at the bottom)
custom_preconds:
Given app has been installed
Given some games for particular date have been completed
Given scheduled games for particular date have different start times
Given the user does not have a favorite team selected.
custom_steps: When the user navigates to the Scoreboard page
custom_expected: Then the scoreboard will appear with games sorted in the order of 1) Ongoing, 2) Scheduled in chronological order, 3) Completed.

title: Favorite team should always stay on top of the list even after game goes final
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed 
And the user has at least one favorite team selected in the app
custom_steps: When the user taps the Scoreboard button
custom_expected: Then the Scoreboard appears and any games featuring the user's favorite team appear at the top of the list regardless of state

title: Favorite team should be indicated by a star
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has selected at least one favorite team in the app
custom_steps: When the user taps the Scoreboard button
custom_expected:
Then the Scoreboard appears and any games featuring the user's favorite team appear at the top of the list.
And the user's team is indicated with a star next to their team name.
(Verify this works properly for teams with longer names - Scranton-Wilkes Yankees)

title: Multiple favorite teams should all receive indication as favorite
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has selected at least two favorite teams
custom_steps: When the user taps the Scoreboard button
custom_expected: Then the Scoreboard appears and any games featuring the user's favorite teams appear at the top of the list

title: Multiple favorites should be in the order set in the settings by the user
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user has selected at least two favorite teams.
custom_steps: When the user taps the scoreboard button
custom_expected:
Then the Scoreboard appears and any games featuring the user's favorite team appear at the top of the list.
And the order in which the games featuring the user's favorite teams is sorted follows the order set in the favorite teams list on the teams page.

title: Team Names
custom_steps: WHEN the user is on Scoreboard and views the team names
custom_expected:
THEN the names displayed should match the 'shortName' from the stats api

i.e.
http://statsapi.mlb.com/api/v1/schedule?hydrate=decisions,probablePitcher,broadcasts(all),game(content(all)),linescore(matchup,runners,positions),stats,person,team,flags&date=04/09/2018&sportId=11,12,13,14,15,16

title: Tapping date should bring up date picker navigation
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the Scoreboard page
custom_steps: When the user taps the date at the top of the scoreboard
custom_expected: Then the date picker navigation should appear

title: Date navigation is bound to appropriate season
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the Scoreboard page
And the date range has been restricted by config
custom_steps: When the user tries to navigate outside the range
custom_expected: Then they will be bound to the desired range (If they can navigate outside the range in any way, this test fails)

title: Day to day navigation, both forward/back
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the scoreboard page
custom_steps: When the user taps the navigation arrow
custom_expected: Then the scoreboard should flip to the previous or next day. (Test both forward and back arrows)

title: Check configurability of season end date
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the scoreboard page
And the date range has been extended past season date in config (Extend season end to post-season dates and confirm navigation works to that date)
custom_steps: When the user attempts to navigate to new date
custom_expected: They will be able to navigate to new date without issue.

title: Check accuracy of team names and logos
custom_preconds: Given the app has been installed
custom_steps: When the user taps the Scoreboard button
custom_expected: Then the scoreboard page should load and the user should see all the team logos. They should appear up to date and correct.

title: Rookie League Score Display
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the Scoreboard page
custom_steps: When the user views the scores on the rookie league scoreboard
custom_expected:
Then only the scores of the leagues supported in the app should appear, Pioneer League & Appalachian League
AND should not display AZL (Arizona League Scoreboard), GCL (Gulf Coast League), nor DSL (Dominican Summer League) scores

title: Prior to game start: Tapping on a game should open preview drawer
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the scoreboard page
custom_steps: When the user taps a scheduled game
custom_expected: Then game preview drawer should open and the user should see: Team logos, Team records, Team vs Team game start time, Field Name.

title: Check accuracy of Pitcher names and stats for all Preview games
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And there is at least one in game in preview state

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to the Scoreboard page
and views info below the game cell of a game in Preview
and Pitchers info is available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the pitcher info appears accordingly:
- TeamNameCode: PitcherName (W-L, ERA) TeamNameCode: PitcherName (W-L, ERA) 

i.e. LHV: Eshelman (1-3, 6.87) SWB: Rogers (3-2, 2.61)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to the Scoreboard page
and views info below the game cell of a game in Preview
and Pitchers info is Not available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the pitcher info appears accordingly:
- TeamNameCode: TBD  TeamNameCode: TBD

i.e. LHV: TBD SWB: TBD

title: Check accuracy of Base pad/Score/Inning for all Live games
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And there is at least one in progress game
custom_steps: When the user navigates to the Scoreboard page
custom_expected:
Then the Base pad/Score/Inning information for active games should be accurate. 
(Check vs. Wap site)

title: Check accuracy of Pitcher & At Bat names and stats for all Live games
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And there is at least one live game
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the Scoreboard page
and views the Pitcher and At Bat info below the game cell of a live game
custom_expected:
Then the following updates accordingly:
- P: PitcherName (#-#, ERA) AB: AtBatName (#-#, AVG)

i.e. P: Barbato (0-0, 2.31) AB: May (24-0, .209)

title: Text and game state formatting should be clear and legible
custom_preconds: Given the app has been installed
custom_steps: When the user taps the Scoreboard button
custom_expected: Then the Scoreboard should appear and the game state information should be clear and legible.

title: Scoreboard should update automatically (Score, game state, and schedule should update live)
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the scoreboard page
custom_steps: When the game is updated (either as live game or by manually stringing)
custom_expected: Then the scoreboard should update automatically according to the frequency set in settings. The score, game state and schedule order should all update automatically.

title: Check scoreboard refresh rate
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And in Settings, Refresh rate, the user sets the refresh rate to:
15 sec
30 sec
1 min
custom_steps: When the user leaves the app on the scoreboard
custom_expected: Then the scoreboard should refresh the intervals set

title: Verify scoreboard updates immediately when returning from Background > Foreground
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the app is in the background
custom_steps: When the user brings the app from the background to the forground
custom_expected: Then the Scoreboard should update immediately

title: Check accuracy of Pitcher names and stats for all Final games
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And there is at least one game in final state
custom_steps:
When the user navigates to the Scoreboard page
and views the Pitcher info below the game cell of a game in final state
custom_expected:
Then the following pitchers info appears accordingly:
- W: WinningPitcherName (W-L, ERA) L: LosingPitcherName (W-L, AVG) S: SavesPitcherName (SV)

i.e. W: Gallen (4-1, 2.25) L: Dziedzic (1-5, 3.66) S: Gallen (0)

title: When app is in AAA mode all logos appear correctly
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the app is in Triple-A Mode
custom_steps: When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
custom_expected: Then all the logos for the teams should appear correctly and belong to the correct team names.

custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the app is in Triple-A Mode
custom_steps: When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
custom_expected: Then all the logos for the teams should appear correctly and belong to the correct team names.

custom_steps: When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
custom_expected: Then all the logos for the teams should appear correctly and belong to the correct team names.

custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed

custom_steps: When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
custom_expected: Then all the logos for the teams should appear correctly and belong to the correct team names.

custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the app is in Class A Short Season Mode
custom_steps: When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
custom_expected: Then all the logos for the teams should appear correctly and belong to the correct team names.

Given the app has been installed
And the app is in Rookie Mode
custom_steps: When the user navigates to the Scoreboard
custom_expected: Then all the logos for the teams should appear correctly and belong to the correct team names.

title: Labels
custom_preconds: GIVEN it's the Post-Season
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the scoreboard
custom_expected:
THEN labels appear above each game cell with the text to indicate the game series:
Game #

title: Ability to manually edit text on scoreboard (postseason text, etc.)_MIAN-198
custom_preconds:
We’d like to have the ability to configure the text during the postseason, on All Classes Scoreboards.
For example: It should read “Triple-A National Championship Game” rather than “AAA Championship Game 1”
Per Emily > the data being pulled in here is coming from a multitude of different strings all mashed up together, so if we can implement a way to just manually override this text that would solve any issues that would arise.

title: Scoreboard - Date picker on Samsung Galaxy S5 is is cutoff at the year_MIAN-227
DO NOT TEST_NOT VALID FOR ANDROID_Check linescore detail (drawer) for all states
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the scoreboard page
custom_steps: When the user taps a game
custom_expected:
The detail drawer should open
And the respective state should appear correctly (Test for: Games in preview, games in progress, final, completed early and extra innings)

title: DO NOT TEST_NOT VALID FOR ANDROID_Extra innings in linescore should be navigable
custom_preconds:
Given the app has been installed
And the user is on the Scoreboard page
And there is a game on the Scoreboard that completed in extra innings
And the drawer for that game is open
custom_steps: When the user scrolls left and right on the linescore
custom_expected: Then the linescore wiil scroll left and right so the user can see the linescore for all innings in the game
